subject: Re: Difference running junit in ant compared to Eclipse
msgSnippet: We have seen this a lot, and the advice to check changes to static fields is bang on.  For us, the most common form this has taken is with singletons. HTH,
messageBody:
We have seen this a lot, and the advice to check changes to static
fields is bang on. For us, the most common form this has taken is
with singletons.

HTH,
Lance

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Bart Reader" <bartreader@...> wrote:
>
> We had differences between running in netbeans , eclips and ant in
eclips.
> The order in whitch the tests are run is not fixed and bad written
> tests could run in one order but not in another.
> I guess you should look for manipulation of static fields.
>
> Bart
>
>
> 2007/3/7, eraonel <eraonel@...>:
> >
> > Hi,
> >
> > I execute a Junit test in Eclipse fine. Then when I run the same test
> > in Ant I get a NullPointerException.
> > Have anyone experienced the same problem?
> >
> > Any hints!
> >
> > cheers,
> >
> > //mikael
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> > Yahoo! Groups Links
> >
> >
> >
> >
>
>
